> What exactly do the text conversion programs do?  A while back I 
> tried playing around with the editor and didn't really have any 
> success -- does the text version make it easier?

The scenario converter program converts the scenario file (*.fss) into 
 text (that can be edited using any text editor) and can convert text 
that is properly formatted into a scenario file (*.fss).

The text editor is about supplementing the existing scenario editor.  
I have found usefull (and faster) in raising and lower level numbers, 
but it's not a good idea to create a scenario from stratch just using 
the scenario converter.  It's NOT a good idea to use the scenario 
converter to edit storyline for a scenario; that's too tricky to avoid 
getting too many spaces.

Only 1 text editor program is 100% functional and it's not mine [gotta 
finish it up and work out bugs].

Hopefully tonight or tomorrow, I'll have a completed storylien ready 
for each scenario in the 50 Project (halfway through breaking down the 
storyline for each scenario).
